# 1. Install Node.js (from https://nodejs.org)
#    Node.js installation includes npm (Node Package Manager).

# 2. Verify installation
node -v   # shows Node.js version
npm -v    # shows npm version

# 3. Create a project folder
mkdir my-ai-project
cd my-ai-project

# 4. Initialize package.json
npm init -y   # quick setup with defaults

# 5. Install dependencies
npm install express        # production dependency
npm install --save-dev nodemon   # development dependency

# 6. Example package.json (auto-generated + edited)
#    This file defines project metadata, dependencies, and scripts.
{
  "name": "my-ai-project",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "description": "Learning AI engineering with Node.js",
  "main": "index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "start": "node index.js",
    "dev": "nodemon index.js"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "express": "^4.18.2"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "nodemon": "^3.0.0"
  },
  "author": "Rehaan",
  "license": "ISC"
}

# 7. Create index.js
cat > index.js << 'EOF'
const express = require('express');
const app = express();

app.get('/', (req, res) => {
  res.send('Hello AI Engineer!');
});

app.listen(3000, () => {
  console.log('Server running on http://localhost:3000');
});
EOF

# 8. Run project
npm start   # runs "node index.js"
npm run dev # runs with nodemon (auto-restarts on file changes)

# Notes:
# - node_modules/ folder stores installed packages. Never edit it directly.
# - Delete node_modules? Restore with: npm install
# - dependencies = needed in production
# - devDependencies = only for development tools
# - Scripts automate tasks (npm run <script>)
